sentences.english: He was hazed by Tom's satire.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的譏諷令他十分窘迫。

sentences.english: Of course, I made sarcastic comments along the way.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我會邊讀邊作充滿譏諷的評論。

sentences.english: Not a false reputation, sarcasm disappear, do more practical work, honor.
sentences.chinese: 不圖虛名，譏諷隨之消失，多幹實事，榮譽不期而至。

sentences.english: The letter is keyed to a tone of sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 使該信帶有一種譏諷的語氣。
那倒是一則譏諷的恭維話。

sentences.english: He worries about his spirituality and then skewers his fellow campers.
sentences.chinese: 他擔心自己的精神性，然後又譏諷他的營友。

sentences.english: This answer came derisively from several places at the same instant.
sentences.chinese: 好幾個人都不約而同地以譏諷的口吻作出回答。

sentences.english: There is little of Satie's sardonic wit to be heard in Skempton's works.
sentences.chinese: 在斯開普頓的作品裏幾乎聽不到薩蒂那種譏諷的智慧。

sentences.english: Is this countrified bleak fundamentalism a spoof?
sentences.chinese: 這種質樸冷酷的原教旨主義也許只是一種譏諷？

sentences.english: "Who'd have guessed it? "she said , sarcasm heavy in her tone .
sentences.chinese: “誰會想到這？”她的聲調裏含着嚴肅的譏諷說。

sentences.english: Her supporters said the retweet was meant as satire.
sentences.chinese: 她的支持者們說那條信息只是譏諷之意。

sentences.english: Because many of them are cuirious, and shouted the sarcastic slogans.
sentences.chinese: 因爲很多人都是看熱鬧的心態，還大喊譏諷性的口號。

sentences.english: Some used the slang slogan on the nameplate to mock the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些人還用銘牌上的俚俗衝鋒口號譏諷警察。

sentences.english: What is unlikely to help is the atmosphere of bitterness and recrimination that is pervading Capitol Hill.
sentences.chinese: 譏諷的氛圍和遍佈國會的互相指責是於是無補的。

sentences.english: Yet there was nothing sarcastic or supercilious in the way Ames spoke.
sentences.chinese: 可是埃姆說話的態度並沒有譏諷或傲慢狂妄的氣味。

sentences.english: Be scorned like old men of less truth than tongue.
sentences.chinese: 被人譏諷爲饒舌老人的信口雌黃。

definition: to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
